sense.name: (Cause to) become physically or metaphorcally harder.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] HARDEN NP2[patient[inanimate]] NP1[topic[inanimate] HARDEN
sense.examples: After one too many disappointments, John hardened his heart. The cold hardened the butter. The factory hardens steel.

sense.name: (Cause to) become fit or habituate to.
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] HARDEN NP2[patient[animate]] Note: Action may be reflexive.
sense.examples: This trip will harden even the most experienced traveller. He hardened himself over weeks in the mountains. These emotional trials have hardened me.
